titles.title: A bill to repeal section 230 of the Communications Act of 1934.
A bill to repeal section 230 of the Communications Act of 1934.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

bill.summary: This bill repeals Section 230 of the Communications Act of 1934, which protects a provider or user of an interactive computer service (e.g., social media company) from liability for screening or blocking objectionable content.
